description: Borrowed from Urdu خانسامان‎, from خان‎ (“master”) +‎ سامان‎ (“household goods”).

entries.meaning: (East India) A house-steward or native servant, being in charge of the kitchen and the food supplies.
examples: An old sinner, in shape of a khansamah, is the genius of the place, and has rarely aught else to tempt the tired traveller with than a “sudden death”—a fowl caught running in the yard, and dished up forthwith;  […]
